metadata.title: CVE-2016-1833 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The htmlCurrentChar function in libxml2 before 2.9.4, as used in Apple iOSbefore 9.3.2, OS X before 10.11.5, tvOS before 9.2.1, and watchOS before2.2.1, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-basedbuffer over-read) via a crafted XML document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1833` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8
libxml2-utils - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8
python-libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8').
